column4: What's the best way of running "cron-like" tasks in ubuntu? I know how to set up Cron, but it doesn't seem like it's being used bu default by the system
so how come crontab -l doesn't reveal anything when running as root?
Hmm... i thought I was supposed to run crontab -e to edit crontab?
since root-account is disabled in *buntu, it makes no sense
It's not disabled?? sudo su root
no recommended and not supported here
if you need a root-shell, use "sudo -i"
sudo -i? Never used that one... care to explain the difference?
it just makes sure you get a proper env similar to a root-login shell
Chipzzz: Ah... thanks. But back to the cron question.. I start by creating a crontab as a user? Say I'd like to run a task every 10 minutes..
but it's a server doing something like dyndns... do I create a user for just this task?
doesn't seem right running this task as my regular user
